criteria: Ability to accurately locate and identify Earth's features (mountains, volcanoes, earthquakes, continental boundaries, ocean trenches) on maps.
Ability to analyze and interpret data from maps to describe patterns of Earth's features.
Understanding of the relationship between plate tectonics and the location of Earth's features.
descriptions: Student cannot locate or identify any Earth's features on the map.
Student can locate or identify one Earth's feature with significant inaccuracies.
Student can locate or identify at least two Earth's features with some inaccuracies.
Student can accurately locate and identify at least three Earth's features with minor inaccuracies.
Student can accurately locate and identify most Earth's features with very few inaccuracies.
Student can accurately and comprehensively locate and identify all Earth's features on the map.
Student cannot analyze or interpret data from the map to describe any patterns.
Student attempts to analyze and interpret data but does not identify any valid patterns or the reasoning is flawed.
Student identifies a pattern but the description is incomplete or contains inaccuracies.
Student identifies and describes a pattern of Earth's features, but the explanation lacks depth.
Student effectively analyzes the map data to describe patterns and provides a reasonable explanation.
Student thoroughly analyzes and interprets the map data to comprehensively describe patterns of Earth's features with insightful explanations, demonstrating a deep understanding.
Student demonstrates no understanding of the relationship between plate tectonics and Earth's features.
Student shows a limited understanding of the role of plate tectonics in the location of Earth's features.
Student explains in vague terms the relationship between plate tectonics and one type of Earth's feature.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of how plate tectonics influences the location of multiple Earth's features.
Student provides a clear explanation of how plate tectonics contributes to the patterns observed in the location of Earth's features.

Student provides a detailed and insightful explanation of how plate tectonics and large-scale system interactions determine the patterns observed in the location of various Earth's features, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding.
